doc.after: Though Bush originally outlined an ambitious domestic agenda, his priorities were significantly altered following the September 11 terrorist attacks in 2001.[100] Wars were waged in Afghanistan and Iraq with significant domestic debates regarding immigration, healthcare, Social Security, economic policy, and treatment of terrorist detainees. Over an eight-year period, Bush's once-high approval ratings[101] steadily declined, while his disapproval numbers increased significantly.[102] In 2007, the United States entered the longest post-World War II recession.[103]
